name: pm
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A1 used when referring to a time in the afternoon or evening or at night: We'll be arriving at about 4.30 p.m. The 6 p.m. train is usually very crowded. Compare
a.m.
More examplesFewer examplesThe moon will be totally eclipsed at 12.10 p.m.The exact time of the accident was 2.43 pm.

politics
  UK informal abbreviation for
prime minister : The PM wants to see you.
business
  informal abbreviation for
project manager : Who's PM on this project?
internet & telecoms
  informal abbreviation for private message: a message sent on a social media website that only the person it is sent to can see: I sent you a PM yesterday. Did you get it?

abbreviation for private message: to send someone a private message on a social media website: PM me if you have any questions.

Add to word list
used when referring to a time between twelve o’clock in the middle of the day and twelve o’clock at night; in the afternoon or evening or at night: Our plane is due to arrive at 8:30 p.m.
